intro: Aneilema lanceolatum subsp. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their ornamental and sometimes medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or swampy areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
